content:
Miguel Raz Guzmán Macedo said:

What are the metrics that we want to talk to people about here?

Iterations:        100
Instructions:      12100
Total Cycles:      3220
Total uOps:        12700

Dispatch Width:    6
uOps Per Cycle:    3.94
IPC:               3.76
Block RThroughput: 31.0
It would be nice to have a small discussion of what these things mean so that people (~me!~) can know what these numbers are saying about their code.

MCA is really only useful on cut-down samples of code, see https://www.llvm.org/docs/CommandGuide/llvm-mca.html (and how it outputs a warning if you have any branches or returns in your assembly)

I don't know a good way to actually get the annotations for it into godbolt to focus on the inner loop.
